main event: Multiple sightings of UFOs were reported over Uzundzhovo, Bulgaria in 1957, including a bright object observed near a military area and an unidentified flying object tracked by ground radar.
interesting points: The UFO was observed hovering and then moving off slowly at night, with ground radar tracking its movements until it disappeared.
A highly credible Turkish Army officer reported seeing a silver, disc-shaped metallic craft hovering at an altitude of 2000 feet above Uzundzhovo Airfield.
An Air Force officer observed a bright white light traveling at high speed, making a 90-degree turn, and then landing without any sound or associated motor noise.
The object observed over Uzundzhovo appeared suddenly, hovered for a few minutes, then accelerated rapidly and disappeared from view, with searchlights converging on it.
There was a hand-drawn sketch depicting the location and track of an unidentified object over Uzundzhovo Air Field, providing additional visual context to the sightings.
sighted object: multiple UFOs, including a bright object and a silver, disc-shaped metallic craft
witnesses: credible witnesses including Turkish Army officers, Air Force officers, and a source with a great deal of experience as an aviator and observer
photographs: no photographs present in the report
